alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Chester; Lehigh; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 13 at 7:21PM EDT until October 13 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Western Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1130 PM EDT. * At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling and flooding occurring at Perkiomen Creek at East Greenville. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Pottstown, Phoenixville, Royersford, Trappe, East Greenville, Schwenksville, Green Lane, Gilbertsville, Spring Mount, Cedarville, Pughtown, and Geryville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 317 and 318. Northeast Extension between mile markers 37 and 44. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
